Compute Resources
These are the processing and computational capabilities that run your applications and workloads: Cloud Compute Resources:
Virtual machines (VMs) with configurable CPU, memory, and storage Container services (like AWS ECS, Azure Container Instances, Google Cloud Run) Serverless functions (AWS Lambda, Azure Functions, Google Cloud Functions) Managed Kubernetes clusters Auto-scaling capabilities that adjust resources based on demand Pay-per-use pricing models
On-Premise Compute Resources:
Physical servers with dedicated hardware Virtualization platforms (VMware, Hyper-V) running multiple VMs Bare-metal servers for high-performance workloads Local container orchestration platforms Fixed capacity that requires upfront hardware investment Direct control over hardware specifications and performance
